item.title: Rev.Robert add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "I am not sure exactly what heaven will be like, but I know that when we die and it comes time for God to judge us, he will not ask, 'How many good things have you done in your life?' rather he will ask, 'How much love did you put into what you did?" -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Rev.Robert add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "Once in an age God sends to some of us a friend who loves in us, not a false-imagining, an unreal character, but looking through the rubbish of our imperfections, loves in us the divine ideal of our nature,--loves, not the man that we are, but the angel that we may be." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Rev.Robert add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Rev.Robert add a quote by Archibald MacLeish
item.description: "Man depends on God for all things: God depends on man for one. Without man's love God does not exist as God, only as creator, and love is the one thing no one, not even God himself, can command. It is a free gift or it is nothing. And it is most itself, most free, when it is offered in spite of suffering, of injustice, and of death . . . The justification of the injustice of the universe is not our blind acceptance of God's inexplicable will, nor our trust in God's love, his dark and incomprehensible love, for us, but our human love, notwithstanding anything, for him." -- Archibald MacLeish
